artefact.overview: Incapacity Benefit is help if you couldn’t work because of an illness or disability before 31 January 2011 - rates and changes to Incapacity Benefit
artefact.body:
Incapacity Benefit has been replaced with Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) - Jobcentre Plus will review your Incapacity Benefit claim to see if you’re capable of work or eligible for ESA.

Your claim won’t be reviewed if you’ll reach State Pension age before 6 April 2014.

Reviewing your claim

If you’re not about to reach State Pension age, Jobcentre Plus will send you a questionnaire between now and 2014. This will ask you how your illness or disability affects your ability to complete everyday tasks.

  1. Complete this questionnaire and return it by the deadline. Include original medical reports or letters that are relevant - you’ll get these back.

  2. Jobcentre Plus will tell you if you need a Work Capability Assessment - you must go.

  3. If your review shows you’re capable of working, Jobcentre Plus will contact you and discuss your next steps, including claiming Jobseeker’s Allowance.

  4. If your review shows you still can’t work, you’ll be transferred automatically onto ESA.

From April 2013 a limit will be put on the total amount of benefit that most people aged 16 to 64 can get. This is called a benefit cap.
